alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 6:53PM EDT until June 25 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Northeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... Southwestern Monmouth County in central New Jersey... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 653 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Browns Mills, or 17 miles west of Toms River, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Presidential Lakes Estates, Wrightstown, Presidential Lakes, Woodruff, Cedar Glen Lakes, Whiting, Browns Mills, Pine Ridge At Crestwood, Holiday City-Berkeley, Country Lake Estates, Crestwood Village, New Egypt, Fort Dix and McGuire AFB. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
